channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Outdoor Programs Open House to be Held October 15
item.description: Date: Tuesday, October 15, 2024 12:00 PM - 2:00 PM - Attend this event to discover what adventures you can participate in and experiences you can share with fellow peers! Contact Will Weinert if you have any questions.
item.author: Students

item.title: “Writing a Literature Review” to be Topic of Graduate Brunch and Learn Session
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 16, 2024 8:30 AM - 11:00 AM - Literature reviews come in many forms, such as a part of a research paper or one chapter of a doctoral dissertation. During this session, Professor Dorit Nevo shows how a literature review is a document — or section of one — that collects key sources on a topic, and discusses those sources in conversation with each other. Seating for this hybrid event is limited; brunch will be served from 8:30 AM to 9:00 AM.
item.author: Students

item.title: OGE Online Workshop to Offer Tips for Dissertation, Thesis Preparation and Submission
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 23, 2024 2:30 PM - 4:00 PM - This workshop will discuss the basics of correct thesis organization and format, appropriate paper attribution and reference citation styles, and review the most common mistakes and ways to avoid them. All students who will be writing a thesis or dissertation are welcome to register and get their questions ready!
item.author: Students

item.title: Webex LTI Legacy Upgraded to Webex LTI 1.3 in Blackboard
item.description: MultiMedia Services wishes to inform the campus community that Webex LTI Legacy (formerly Webex Education Connector) has been upgraded in Blackboard to the new Webex LTI 1.3 connector. This is the final upgrade prior to the start of the semester, and brings in increased stability and features for utilizing Webex within a course in Blackboard. Please refer to the ITSSC Knowledge Base for more information.
item.author: Community

item.title: “Remembering the Stonewall Uprising – 55 Years Later” Exhibit on Display in Folsom Library
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 25, 2024 - Tue , October 15, 2024 (all day) - On June 28, 1969, LGBTQ+ patrons at the Stonewall Inn in New York fought back against police harassment, helping to spawn the LGBTQIA+ rights movement. To honor this event, the LGBTQ+ Task Force is proud to present an exhibit on the history of the Stonewall Uprising on the main floor of Folsom Library, using archival sources from the Stonewall National Museum, Archives, and Library to show the Uprising’s important history.
item.author: Community

item.title: ECSE Seminar Slated for October 15
item.description: Date: Tuesday, October 15, 2024 5:00 PM - 6:00 PM - This ECSE seminar will feature a presentation titled “Concomitant Linear DAG Estimation” with Gonzalo Mateos, an Associate Professor at the University of Rochester.
item.author: Community

item.title: Session to Review Certificates in Analytics, Machine Learning and AI
item.description: Date: Tuesday, October 15, 2024 7:00 PM - 7:30 PM - Join Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph.D., for a session highlighting Rensselaer’s online, project-based graduate certificate programs in Analytics, Machine Learning and AI. Attendees can expect to learn how data can inform better decisions, and will review an analytic method that can be used regardless of the tools at hand. Please register to attend.
item.author: Community

item.title: RPI Students Take Leadership Role at the Intersection of Finance and Quantum
item.description: Rensselaer students developed more than 30% of the available finance coding libraries in Qiskit — the open-source software development environment for working with quantum computers — using RPI’s quantum computer, the only quantum computer in the world available on a university campus.
item.author: Community

item.title: Vollmer W. Fries Lecture Scheduled for October 16
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 16, 2024 2:00 PM - 4:00 PM - During this lecture, Dr. Jianjun Shi from the H. Milton Stewart School of Industrial and Systems Engineering at Georgia Institute of Technology will present a lecture on “Co-Evolution of Data Science, Data Modality, and Modeling of Multistage Manufacturing Processes.” Everyone is welcome!
item.author: Community

item.title: Quantum Computing Users Group Monthly Meeting Scheduled for October 16
item.description: Join students and colleagues interested in quantum computing or those currently working on the subject at noon on Wednesday, October 16 in Amos Eaton 214. If you are interested in presenting, please contact Tom Morgan.
item.author: Community

item.title: “The Other Side of Silence” Coming to EMPAC
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 16, 2024 7:00 PM - “The Other Side of Silence” examines technology’s role in the fabric of human society and the role it plays in promoting and diminishing our autonomy, as seen through the lens of an augmentative and alternative communication user – someone who uses a synthetic voice to communicate with the world. Through a series of interwoven storylines, this new opera explores what it means to be our true self, and which of our voices best represents our identity.
item.author: Community

item.title: Chemistry Continues Fall Seminar Series October 15
item.description:
Date: Tuesday, October 15, 2024 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - Chemistry’s seminar series continues with Dr. Fabian Faulstich, from Mathematical Sciences at RPI, who will speak on the topic “A Mathematical Perspective of Coupled-Cluster Theory — The Gold Standard of Quantum Chemistry.”

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
item.author: Community
